title: 153. Rose Hartley: Maggie's Going Nowhere
itunes:author: Words and Nerds: Authors, books and literature.
itunes:summary:
Praise for Maggie’s Going Nowhere
“Maggie’s Going Nowhere is a whip-smart and heartwarming novel.” – Miranda Tapsell
“Fizzing with biting wit, this clever debut is deliciously readable.” – Nicola Moriarty
“A fast-paced zinger of a debut novel…smart, funny, and more than a little rough around the edges, Maggie has TV sitcom character written all over her.” – Megan Miller, Herald Sun
“A spirited and sometimes very funny beach read.” – The Saturday Age
“This indiscreet, irresponsible anti-heroine dances to her own tune. Rose Hartley’s debut is a riotous, raunchy ride through grungy Melbourne.” – Maureen Sherlock, SA Weekend
“You can’t help but love goodtime gal Maggie Cotton, even though she’s a bit of a wreck, wouldn’t know a day’s hard work if she fell over it and has unhealthy romances.” – Leanne Edmistone, Courier Mail

description:
Praise for Maggie’s Going Nowhere
“Maggie’s Going Nowhere is a whip-smart and heartwarming novel.” – Miranda Tapsell
“Fizzing with biting wit, this clever debut is deliciously readable.” – Nicola Moriarty
“A fast-paced zinger of a debut novel…smart, funny, and more than a little rough around the edges, Maggie has TV sitcom character written all over her.” – Megan Miller, Herald Sun
“A spirited and sometimes very funny beach read.” – The Saturday Age
“This indiscreet, irresponsible anti-heroine dances to her own tune. Rose Hartley’s debut is a riotous, raunchy ride through grungy Melbourne.” – Maureen Sherlock, SA Weekend
“You can’t help but love goodtime gal Maggie Cotton, even though she’s a bit of a wreck, wouldn’t know a day’s hard work if she fell over it and has unhealthy romances.” – Leanne Edmistone, Courier Mail
